objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: National Cyber Security Centre, identified as the author and publisher of this report, providing detailed malware and threat analysis.

objects.name: Malicious Shared Object
objects.description: Malicious ELF shared object injected into /bin/sshd using LD_PRELOAD for persistence and backdoor functionality.

objects.name: Target Binary for Injection
objects.description: Legitimate SSH daemon binary targeted by LD_PRELOAD for malware injection.

objects.name: Backdoor Unix Socket
objects.description: Malware-created Unix socket used for backdoor communication.

objects.name: Malware IPC Unix Client Socket
objects.description: Malware-related Unix client socket, associated with IPC functionality.

objects.name: Older Malware IPC Socket
objects.description: IPC Unix server socket used by earlier Pygmy Goat variant.

objects.name: Malware PID File
objects.description: Single instance PID file to prevent multiple executions of malware.

objects.name: Older Variant PID File
objects.description: Single instance PID file used by earlier variant of the malware.

objects.name: Example C2 IP for test/virtual environment
objects.description: IPv4 address used in C2 callback trigger in example (indicative only, not threat actor infrastructure).

objects.name: EarthWorm Proxy Destination (Example)
objects.description: Domain used as an example EarthWorm server in command tasking (indicative only).

objects.name: Malicious Shared Object Path
objects.description: Path where malicious shared object may be found on compromised devices.

objects.name: pygmy goat
objects.description: Pygmy Goat is a native x86-32 ELF shared object discovered on Sophos XG firewall devices, providing backdoor access by using LD_PRELOAD to hook the sshd binary's accept function. It listens for ICMP trigger packets or SSH connections containing magic bytes to activate C2. Features include remote shell access, packet capture via libpcap, deployment of cron tasks using embedded BusyBox, and creating a reverse SOCKS proxy server (via EarthWorm source code) for lateral movement or tunneling. The malware uses an embedded CA certificate masquerading as Fortinet to establish encrypted TLS C2 and employs multiple persistence strategies involving startup script modification. Designed with extensibility and avoids device-specific dependencies, suggesting adaptability for various Linux distributions.

objects.name: libsophos.so
objects.description: Malicious shared object that is loaded into /bin/sshd, serving as the core implant for Pygmy Goat. It uses LD_PRELOAD for injection, hooks the accept function for advanced SSH interception, and manages C2 communications. Earlier variants lacked the reverse proxy functionality and were obfuscated with VMProtect.

objects.name: Fortinet Ltd.
objects.description: Referenced in the embedded CA certificate used by Pygmy Goat for TLS C2 verification. This is not an actual involvement but is impersonated by the malware to enhance C2 trust and detection evasion.

objects.name: Sophos
objects.description: Vendor of the Sophos XG firewall, which is the initial observed victim device of Pygmy Goat deployment.

objects.name: Mandiant
objects.description: Referenced as an external threat intelligence source, drawing parallels between Pygmy Goat and CASTLETAP attacks on FortiGate devices.

objects.name: CrowdStrike
objects.description: Cited as an industry source for historical reporting on EarthWorm use by threat actors. Not directly involved in this incident.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_aes_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_magic_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule pygmy_goat_magic_strings
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Pygmy Goat magic byte sequences used in C2 comms"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$c2_magic_handshake = ",bEB3?=o"
$fake_ssh_banner = "SSH-2.0-D8pjE"
$fake_ed25519_key = { 29 cc f0 cc 16 c5 46 6e 52 19 82 8e 86 65 42 8c 1f 1a d4 c3 a5 b1 cb fc c0 26 6c 31 3c 5c 90 3a 24 7d e4 d3 57 6d da 8e cb f4 66 d1 cb 81 4f 63 fd 4a fa 06 e4 7e 4c a0 95 91 bd cb 97 a4 b3 0f }

condition:

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and any of them

}

objects.name: earthworm_id_generation_x86
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule earthworm_id_generation_x86
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "EarthWorm pool num generation x86 assembly"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$chartoi = {

8b 45 ??        // MOV
c1 e0 07        // SHL
89 c1           // MOV
8b 55 ??        // MOV
8b 45 ??        // MOV
01 d0           // ADD
0f b6 00        // MOVZX
0f be c0        // MOVSX
01 c8           // ADD
89 45 ??        // MOV
83 6d ?? 01     // SUB

EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,0x7
ECX,EAX
EDX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,EDX
EAX,byte ptr [EAX]
EAX,AL
EAX,ECX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],EAX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],0x1

}

condition:

}

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and all of them

objects.name: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to inject into sshd

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a /bin/sh or /bin/csh remote shell

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Cron
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create arbitrary cron tasks using crontab

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses Unix sockets for inter-process communication between parent and forked child processes

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can use libpcap to sniff network traffic according to a BPF filter and exfiltrate it to the C2

objects.name: Traffic Signaling: Port Knocking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat listens on an ICMP raw socket for encrypted packets containing magic bytes and the C2 address to connect back to

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol Impersonation
objects.description: Pygmy Goat responds to an SSH connection that sends magic bytes with a fake SSH handshake

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Asymmetric Cryptography
objects.description: Pygmy Goat encrypts C2 communications with TLS

objects.name: Protocol Tunneling
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a reverse SOCKS5 proxy server to tunnel traffic through it

objects.name: Archive Collected Data: Archive via Library
objects.description: Pygmy Goat compresses its C2 communications with LZO1X

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Pygmy Goat exfiltrates its result data over its C2 channel

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Pygmy Goat
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. pygmy goat.
